intro: Baccharoides nimbaensis, commonly known as the Nimba barberry, is a shrub native to the Nimba Mountains of West Africa. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in semi-arid to subhumid climates. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are often white or pale yellow. The species is of interest for its ornamental value and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
